Allocation module¶

Created on Wed May 2 11:32:35 2018

@author: jpelda

class Allocation.Allocation[source]¶

Bases: object

alloc_inhabs_to_nodes(gdf_raster, gdf_nodes, graph)[source]¶

Allocates inhabitans to nodes. Nodes in same raster field will get raster’s inhabitans divided by amout of nodes within raster. Raster fields without nodes are allocated to nearest node.

Args: gdf_raster(geopandas.GeoDataFrame()):

gdf[‘SHAPE’], gdf[‘SHAPE_b’], gdf[‘inhabs’]
gdf_nodes : geopandas.GeoDataFrame()
gdf[‘osmid’], gdf[‘geometry’]

graph : nx.Graph()

list_of_inhabs : list(floats)
List of floats is in order of gdf_nodes
alloc_nodes_to_inhabs(gdf_raster, gdf_nodes)[source]¶

Allocates points of gdf to fields of gdf_census.

gdf_raster : geopandas.GeoDataFrame()
gdf_raster[‘inhabs’]
gdf_nodes : geopandas.GeoDataFrame()
gdf_nodes[‘geometry’].boundary
list_of_inhabs : list(floats)
List of floats is in order of gdf_nodes
alloc_wc_from_b_to_node(gdf_gis_b, gdf_nodes, graph)[source]¶

Allocates the water consumption of each building in GIS-Data to nearest node of graph.

gdf_gis_b : geopandas.GeoDataFrame()
gdf[‘geometry’], gdf[‘wc’], gdf[‘area’]

graph : nx.Graph()

list_of_wc : list(floats)
List of floats is in order of gdf_nodes of graph
alloc_wc_to_type(gis_cat, types)[source]¶

Allocates waste consumption to types coming from gis_builings.

gis_cat : pandas.DataFrame()
gis_cat[‘type’], gis_cat[‘cat’]
types : [str]
Types to which wc is allocated. Types are found in gis_cat[‘type’]
wc : [float]
Returns the water consumption for each type in types.
